newsitem.title: UK: Australia's Colonial votes for end to mutuality.
newsitem.headline: Australia's Colonial votes for end to mutuality.

text.p: Members of Australia's Colonial Mutual insurance group are to receive shares and options valued at A$1.3 billion after they voted in favour of proposals to demutualise the company, Colonial said in London on Tuesday.
Over 36 percent of Colonial's 538,000 members voted and 97 percent of those supported demutualisation.

"Members should be very satisfied with the exchange of their ownership rights under the mutual structure for their shareholding and full participation in future profits of the business," said chairman David Adam in a statement.
Colonial plans to list on the Australian and New Zealand stock exchanges in the second quarter of 1997, but must seek court approval first to end its 124-year-old mutual structure.
Colonial, which has funds under management in excess of A$36 billion, is expected to have a market capitalisation of U.S. $1.5 billion on listing.
